title: 114_hr3950
content: Veteran Small Business Tax Credit Act of 2015 This bill allows a new business-related tax credit for the start-up expenses of a veteran-owned small business. The allowable amount of such credit is 15 of start-up expenditures that do not exceed $80,000. The credit is allowed to any individual who: (1) has served on active duty in the US Armed Forces, (2) was stationed outside the United States, and (3) was not discharged or released under dishonorable conditions.
